alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 9:58AM CST until January 31 at 12:32AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Fort Bend and Wharton Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River near Boling. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding continues with significant backwater flooding up Peach Creek and minor backwater flooding up West Bernard Creek in Wharton County. Backwater flooding up Snake Creek threatens low lying areas in the Tierra Grande subdivision. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Sunday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CST Sunday was 24.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.1 feet on 12/18/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed San Bernard River Boling 18.0 24.2 Sun 9 am CST 21.8 18.1 13.3 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening.late tonight at 400 AM CST.
